document.masterDocTitle: The lanternfly genus Penthicodes: key to the species and review of the “ Ereosoma group ” with two new species and one new subspecies (Hemiptera: Fulgoromorpha: Fulgoridae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The lanternfly genus Penthicodes: key to the species and review of the “ Ereosoma group ” with two new species and one new subspecies (Hemiptera: Fulgoromorpha: Fulgoridae)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:

in Duperrey, 1838 : 185 , synonymised by Stål 1863 : 232

., synonymised by

: 27

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnostic characters: (
1
) tegmina with 2 large black spots in costal cell (rarely absent) and no spot on membrane, one white patch along sutural margin on nodal line (
Figs. 2
A, 3 A); (
2
) legs I and II dark brown without pale yellow rings (
Figs. 2
E, 3 E); (
3
) head and pronotum paler than mesonotum (
Figs. 2
B, 3 B); (
4
) disc of hind wings red (
Fig. 2
A) or orange (
Fig. 3
A) with 6–15 black spots in 3 rows and 4 ( 3–5 ) small white spots (
Figs. 2
A, 3 A); (
5
) abdominal tergites red, sometimes black medio-basally (
Figs. 2
A, 3 A).
